title: Typographic Times: František Štorm interview, Pulp fiction in typography and Fontplay
content:
September issue of the [**Typographic Times**](http://web.archive.org/web/20131013173414/http:/www.planet-typography.com/news/):

[Interview of František Štorm](http://web.archive.org/web/20131013173414/http:/www.planet-typography.com/news/designer/storm.html)  
“Typography happens in books, not on street.”

[Portrait of his newly designed Anselm type system](http://web.archive.org/web/20131013173414/http:/www.planet-typography.com/news/typeface/anselm.html)  
“Our goal was to create an all-round type family, equally suitable for poetry, magazines, books, posters, and information systems.”

[Pulp fiction in typography](http://web.archive.org/web/20131013173414/http:/www.planet-typography.com/news/typo/pulp-fiction.html)  
“The assignment was to take an audio clip with words in it, and then try to capture the intonation of the scene.”

[Free fonts in action with Fontplay.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20131013173414/http:/www.planet-typography.com/news/typo/fontplay.html)  
Playing with fonts or the art of expressive typography
author: Typook

comments.content:
Cool. Although you're a little late with featuring that Pulp Fiction motion piece. ;)  
But since it's very good, I guess it deserves the extra attention.
